title: Ticket #335: condor_starter 7.3.0 segfault
description:
Found this in a starter 7.3.0 starter log on k2.cs.wisc.edu: 

03/19 15:15:59 ********** STARTER starting up ***********
03/19 15:15:59 ** $CondorVersion: 7.3.0 Feb 17 2009 BuildID: 132922 $
03/19 15:15:59 ** $CondorPlatform: I386-LINUX_RHEL5 $
03/19 15:15:59 ******************************************
03/19 15:15:59 Submitting machine is "sleepy.cs.wisc.edu"
03/19 15:15:59 EventHandler {
03/19 15:15:59  func = 0x8105fc8
03/19 15:15:59  mask = SIGALRM SIGHUP SIGINT SIGUSR1 SIGUSR2 SIGCHLD SIGTSTP
03/19 15:15:59 }
03/19 15:16:23 condor_read(): recv() returned -1, errno = 104, assuming failure
reading 5 bytes from unknown source.
03/19 15:16:23 IO: Failed to read packet header
Stack dump for process 19569 at timestamp 1237493783 (12 frames)
condor_starter(dprintf_dump_stack+0xd0)[0x8101b01]
condor_starter[0x8101cbe]
[0xfe1420]
/lib/libc.so.6(abort+0x101)[0xbbf691]
/lib/libc.so.6(__assert_fail+0xfb)[0xbb71fb]
condor_starter(REMOTE_CONDOR_register_fs_domain+0x148)[0x80ec460]
condor_starter(_Z21init_environment_infov+0x2b)[0x80dbf5d]
condor_starter(_Z4initv+0x10)[0x80dd3f6]
condor_starter(_ZN12StateMachine7executeEv+0x181)[0x8106237]
condor_starter(main+0x179)[0x80dd5f5]
/lib/libc.so.6(__libc_start_main+0xdc)[0xbaae8c]
condor_starter(realloc+0x79)[0x80dbc11]

Looks bad and needs work.

Ticket #183, though closed at the time of this writing, may be related.
remarks:
2009-Oct-08 16:35:55 by danb:
I think the real problem here is that the standard universe starter calls abort() via assert in expected code paths, such as the path followed when there are communication failures with the shadow. This results in core files being generated and people wasting time trying to find bugs where there are none.

I created a new ticket #828 about this unfortunate behavior in the std. univ. starter.
